intro: Dendromyza latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf forest plant, is a tropical shrub characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and potentially useful in horticultural applications.
